positive.review:
"Capitalism knows only one color: that color is green; all else is necessarily subservient to it, hence, race, gender and ethnicity cannot be considered within it." - Thomas Sowell 

It's very much a background game, it‚Äôs simple, it‚Äôs absurd, and it knows exactly what it is a numbers go up idle game with a goofy sense of humor and a steady stream of progression. The early game is pretty satisfying as you unlock managers, automate your businesses, and watch your income skyrocket. There‚Äôs something inherently addictive about doubling revenue over and over, and the game leans into that power fantasy with a clean interface and plenty of silly flavor. The mid to late game gets grindy unless you‚Äôre willing to engage with the monetization. Events help break things up, but they often feel tuned to encourage spending rather than pure play. Still, if you‚Äôre here for incremental progression and don‚Äôt mind checking in occasionally, there‚Äôs a pleasant loop underneath it all.

This is a fun time waster of a game, like most idle clickers are. I will warn new players though that the devs have pretty much abandoned the Steam version. If you run into any issues, help will be hard to find. 

Definitely do not spend money on the Steam version. If you like it enough to want to spend money than I would suggest the mobile version of the game.

After dedicating the last 3 months of my life to this damn game
I finally have got every acheivment.
and so when steam asks me. would you like to recomed this game to other players. I would hesitate to say yes. But the sunk cost falicy requires me say yes.
8/10 would do again

üç™ Soft & Chewy Cookies Recipe
Ingredients (Makes ~18 cookies)
~1/2 cup (113g) unsalted butter, softened
~1/2 cup (100g) white sugar
~1/2 cup (110g) brown sugar (this helps keep the cookie soft)
~1 large egg
~1 tsp vanilla extract
~1 ¬Ω cups (190g) all-purpose flour
~1/2 tsp baking soda
~1/4 tsp salt
(Optional) 1 cup chocolate chips or anything you want to add

ü•£ Instructions
1. Cream butter + sugars
~Beat softened butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until creamy (1‚Äì2 minutes).

2. Add egg + vanilla
~Mix until smooth.

3. Add dry ingredients
~In another bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, and salt. Add this to the wet mixture and mix just until combined.
(Do NOT overmix ‚Äî overmixing makes cookies hard.)

4. Add chocolate chips
~Fold in gently.

5. Chill dough (IMPORTANT for softness)
~Chill the dough in the fridge 30 minutes. This stops spreading and keeps the inside soft.

6. Shape & bake
~Preheat oven to 175¬∞C (350¬∞F)
~Scoop 1 tablespoon-sized balls
~Leave space between cookies
~Bake 8‚Äì10 minutes
Cookies should look slightly underbaked in the middle ‚Äî they will continue cooking on the tray.

7. Rest
Let cookies cool on the tray for 5 minutes, then move to a rack.

üí° Tips for Extra Softness
~Use more brown sugar than white if you want extra soft cookies.
~Don‚Äôt bake too long ‚Äî soft cookies always look a bit raw in the center.
~Add 1 extra egg yolk for ultra-soft texture.
~Bing Chilling is your best friend.
this game is so inefficient that on cold nights i would open the game so that my computer would work as a heating apparatus
Its alright, a mega reset everything button would help. Done a lot of stupid mistakes and I just wanna start over. Addicting game tbh
Endless loops and lots of upgrade restarts. Pretty fun. Hosts plenty of special events

Great clicker game have OCD in seeking achievements. The events are fun. The pun names of managers is absolutely a tap into my nerdy self. Once I get 100% I will probably switch on to another one, but it is entertaining until then.
Good Soup. Good Misc side screen game if your doing other things and want to build your Capatilist empire

7/10
The game was fun, but it takes time to complete all the achievements. Luckily, I played it a while ago and reinstalled it to finish all the achievements using the gold I had saved up. I finished it in a few days. I finished Mars first, then the Moon and Earth. You reset and get free gold to get rid of the other planets. I didn't buy anything, just played F2p.

I‚Äôve spent some time with this game and honestly, it surprised me in a way I didn‚Äôt fully expect. I don‚Äôt want to sound dramatic, but there‚Äôs something oddly satisfying about how everything fits together ‚Äî not in some perfect, polished ‚Äúadvertisement‚Äù way, but more like a game that knows exactly what it wants to be and just‚Ä¶ goes for it.

The first thing I noticed is the atmosphere. Every part of the game ‚Äî the visuals, the sound, the pacing ‚Äî kind of blends into this feeling that you‚Äôre actually inside its world, even if you‚Äôre just casually playing. I know that sounds a bit clich√©, but it‚Äôs true. Sometimes it‚Äôs chaotic, sometimes slow, sometimes you‚Äôre just wandering around thinking ‚Äúok, what now?‚Äù but that‚Äôs honestly part of the charm. The game doesn‚Äôt try to rush you unless it actually needs to.

Gameplay-wise, it has this mix of familiar elements and small twists that keep things from feeling stale. Nothing groundbreaking, maybe, but it all works together in a way that feels natural. There were moments when I thought ‚Äúyeah, I‚Äôve seen this in other games,‚Äù but then the game throws in tiny details or unexpected interactions that make it stand out just enough. It‚Äôs the kind of thing you only notice after a few hours, when you start connecting the dots.

Performance has been mostly fine. A little rough spot here and there, but honestly, show me a game these days that doesn‚Äôt have something weird happening once in a while. Nothing game-breaking on my end, at least. You can clearly tell the developers put effort into this, even if a few edges are still a bit sharp. Again ‚Äî part of the charm.

What I really appreciate is that the game gives you space to play the way you want. Some people will rush through every objective, others will take their time exploring or messing around, and both approaches actually feel valid. I like games that don‚Äôt punish you for not following some ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù path.

Overall, I‚Äôd say this is one of those titles that grows on you the longer you play. It doesn‚Äôt try too hard to impress in the first five minutes ‚Äî instead it slowly builds its identity, layer by layer, until you suddenly realize you‚Äôve been playing way longer than you planned. If you‚Äôre looking for something that balances comfort with challenge, familiar mechanics with fresh touches, and a world that‚Äôs just fun to be in, then I genuinely think this one is worth giving a shot.

Would I recommend it?
Yeah, I would ‚Äî maybe not to everyone, because no game is for everyone, but definitely to anyone who likes getting lost in a game for a bit and discovering things at their own pace.
Even though this is a mobile game that is all about idling, its surprisingly addicting and i have over 80 hours on mobile.

Play as little or as much as you like; this idle clicker game comes with a small amount of strategy and regular time-limited events that involve you working hard to claim higher rewards. The more you play, the better the rewards, which means you do not have to purchase any extras. This game runs in the background as a mild distraction, and when you read into the descriptions and text in game, you appreciate the comedy with names, tasks and achievements.

I do find the astronomical numbers in the currency a little unnecessary (and un-pronouceable at times) and it can prove to be a little difficult at times when the multipliers, cost and profit do not correlate well and you don't seem to gain value or afford to upgrade. These minor things aside, the game works well with minimal glitches or bugs, bright and bold colours with very simple game-play mechanics means I would recommend this as an alternative to similar idle clicker games for mobile (although is available on Mobile, Consoles and Steam).

heres the real strat

1. Have atleast every business on earth
2. leave it for a year (dont even think about touching it)
3. come back and buy the moon
4. use the moon to grind 100 megabucks (events also come in handy)
5. spend that megabucks on megatickets and put all of them on the businesses on earth
6. bet it all on black

A really basic clicker idle tycoon game. I enjoyed playing it, i've been playing this for like 3 months, and at least there was something i could do. It was grindy, yes, but that was what was good in it. It'd always come handy when i was bored. Would definitely recommend it!

It's an okay game, pretty boring at times, to be honest. It was kind of fun at first, but trying to win the whole game and achieve all the achievements can become tedious. However, it's not all bad; it might take me a year or two, but I'll get there. I definitely think you should play it for yourself, especially if you're an achievement hunter.
Classic idle clicker goodness. Super simple, super addictive, and weirdly satisfying to watch your money explode into ridiculous numbers.
This game is very fun but if you have a laptop it will try to blow up your laptop. Also the events kinda suck and have weird scaling.

It's addictive. It's like a very simplistic version of running a business where you do the mundane task (hitting a button) and then save up enough money to hire someone to do it, and then get backers and really expand. And there are hidden tactics and methods built in to do it better. It's fun to see your money stacking up.
Pure idle game crack. Click, invest, profit ‚Äî and suddenly it‚Äôs 3 AM and you‚Äôre a fake billionaire.
Wish the upgrades came faster, but it‚Äôs strangely satisfying watching my profits explode.

After 100% all the achievements on this game I feel like I can give a honest review. If you are a person that likes to get all the achievements on your games for Adventure Capitalist I would say that it is not too challenging but it does take a lot of time. It was a while ago since I got every achievement, but I still remember the relief I felt when I got that last one.

Other Comments:
This games style is very unique and I would say this is one of the more cleaner examples of a good idle game. I personally really like the other planets you can go to so the main game doesn't get too boring and you can manage multiple things at once.

Fun idle clicker game! I've never felt bored or frustrated. I think the game is well designed and got all achievements after 70h, and without paying a dime. The art style is also really nice! Recommended for for incremental fans.
its fun and kinda boring but its still a good game to pretend to have money

I think many of us who played this game knew it from peak mobile gaming, and honestly, this game still holds on well like, 8 years later. 
Well, it's an idle game, and the different main planets / events that happen have the same gameplay loop, but, the moneitisation can be very put aside unless you really want to support the devs, which, no shame. 
The events, even though you can get through every one in a few months (there is an event every week or two), offer some reward when you advance pretty far into them, which translate into the main planets. Which cool ! 

Do recommend for anyone searching for a whacky idle game !

Can be fun for the first couple of days, but it quickly becomes repetitive and uninspired. AdVenture Capitalist is one of those small idle games where the objective is to see numbers increse; the more money you have, the more businesses you can buy to make even more money, similarly to Cookie Clicker. Is fun the concept of seeing those numbers balloon over when checking the PC after hours, but to be honest, in retrospective I see it as a waste of time. I appreciate AdVenture Capitalist to be FTP, but I cannot in good faith say I enjoyed it.
Absolutely not, go do something better with your life, and if you can't, then play this lmao

Fun idler but the devs have stated they wont be updating the steam version anymore so they can just do updates on the android/ios version. So I can't recommend this game since its effectively been abandoned.

It chewed up every resource on my PC and caused the system to lag trying to even search on google. The game itself was fine but if that's the only application I can use while using my new mid-high end PC it's a barely optimised game (can't even cap frame rate) I've played on my phone before and loved it but if it uses 100% of my CPU whenever I play I'll likely stick with the mobile version
At some point in the game it really becomes pay to play. Events are impossible to beat without autoclicker or boosts, moon is extremely slow so it forces you to use boosts.
Can't launch on laptops. You get a error message saying to switch resolutions and that still fails. You shouldn't have to do a bunch of steps to play a idle game. I try every few weeks with no change
worst game ever, can't reset your save even while following the way overcomplicate things to do by the devs to reset.

The gameplay loop is addictive, but not engaging. Also, why does the game need so much CPU power? EDIT: Also, why are some of the events just carbon copies of each other (e.g., Profit-A-Bowl and The Excellent Adventure have the same milestones and same fundamental businesses).
Listen man, it's a fine game. It's fun. It's a notable entry in the clicker game genre. But I just can't with this title. It's just not worth your time.

I just can't recommend a game that seems to go out of its way to make the majority of the multipliers 6, 66 or 666.

I have a lot of hours in this game, but I'm going to be uninstalling it.  All of the special events also favor the 6s.

I am a moderate fan / player of this genre. 
I don't hate this game, am on the fence, but have to say No.
The progression is very monotonous, and difficult to impossible to achieve any special event tasks. One time I burned a full 8 time warps, had this buying/updating almost continuously, and was unable to claim the very first timed task. 
I am not spending $10 or $100 just to claim a single timed event prize. I don't mind paying to accelerate progress overall, but having to pay just to grab a single timed award is a dealbreaker for me.
Started this game Sep 2017, it is 2025, still have the same exact money 8 years later.

Honestly? it's a nice time waster when bored, but it feels impossible to complete anything without putting some real cash into it just to finish an event that last 3 days. Unless you want a game you'll always check constantly and clear to 100%, I don't recommend it.

a clicker game that, within a blink of an eye, turns into an idle game purely beckoning a visit every few hours - three of these exist + a limited time one that all work exactly the same with a little difference here and there yet the same concepts bleed through. it becomes insanely repetitive almost immediately, not to mention that there's a plethora of bugs that have workarounds rather than fixes + the application runs poorly. microtransactions are a bummer, but it is worth noting that you can get them without purchasing.

i want to give a huge shout-out to the support for this game for getting my angels from a different platform so i could finish this within moments (once i realized this was an option) rather than plugging in months to get to the point of finishing the achievements. it is commendable to still have events and this active of a support team in a ten-year-old game so kudos are definitely in order.

there are better idle games out there.
stupidly addicting time waster that's hard to stop once you start. classic idle game. can't wait to finally get all achievements and be relinquished from this hell
Bad game design so you have to spend money or earn items in tedious events to compensate for it

Less fun to play than Cookie Clicker. Feels like just a cheap knock-off of it. The fun content runs out after a few hours and there is little left to do. Much, much less content than Cookie Clicker.

In Adventure Capitalist the buildings produce money only discretely, which might even be every many hours, while in Cookie Clicker, it is a continuous stream of cookies. Which means, even if your production is high, Adventure Capitalist mostly consists of waiting your most high value buildings to produce, which are also the slowest  ones. I don‚Äôt like this mechanic, but maybe someone does. In Cookie Clicker it is also possible to get some golden cookies and combos which reward active play, which is not the case in here. 

While Cookie Clicker is a funny, absurd, ironic, satirical game, Adventure Capitalist just feels serious and realistic in its tone and makes it more boring. It tries to be a bit funny, but it just isn't. Also Adventure Capitalist has micro-transactions, which fits the theme perfectly and is exactly what I expected, but makes the game more boring for me.

On the other hand, Adventure Capitalist is game is free to play and takes little space on the computer, and runs on a potato, so I cannot complain. But - so is Cookie Clicker, with a free browser and mobile version, almost exactly the same as the Steam version. Anyway I got the Steam version of Cookie Clicker just because I liked the game so much though, even if I didn't have to, just to support it. Cookie Clicker costs 5‚Ç¨ here on Steam, please get it you can afford it.

TL;DR: Go play Cookie Clicker, it is a much better game

On the other hand, Adventure Capitalist is game is free to play and takes little space on the computer, and runs on a potato, so I cannot complain. But - so is Cookie Clicker, with a free browser and mobile version, almost exactly the same as the Steam version. Anyway I got the Steam version of Cookie Clicker just because I liked the game so much though, even if I didn't have to, just to support it. Cookie Clicker costs 5‚Ç¨ here on Steam, please get it you can afford it.

TL;DR: Go play Cookie Clicker, it is a much better game
Listen man, it's a fine game. It's fun. It's a notable entry in the clicker game genre. But I just can't with this title. It's just not worth your time.

For some reason I got banned and can't even open the game after adding 700,000 gold to my account using hacks. Can someone tell me why I got banned? This game is so busted. Also there's a faint white noise that just loops when you mute the game in settings. Pretty annoying.

I just can't recommend a game that seems to go out of its way to make the majority of the multipliers 6, 66 or 666.

I have a lot of hours in this game, but I'm going to be uninstalling it.  All of the special events also favor the 6s.

Better than most clicker games, tough, that isn't a high bar to cross. Solid gameplay, tries to keep you engaged, but all in well, still fails and I come across it in my steam library and play it in intervals of a few months. Bravo, Hyper Hippo games. You made a dumpster fire that somehow always keeps lit.
